intro: Mosiera flavicans subsp. cabanasensis, commonly known as the Cabanasense Flavican, is a rare and endemic species native to specific regions of South America. It is a shrub characterized by its yellowish flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. It has small, clustered inflorescences that bloom during the wet season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
